Interface HashTableInterface<T extends PersonInterface>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    HashTable

    public interface HashTableInterface<T extends PersonInterface>
    methods for a HashTable of Person objects. It is implemented as an array of LinkedLists STUDENT - 1. provide constructor that takes in an int for the number of Person objects to hold 2. To choose size of your Hash Table (number of buckets): The first 4K+3 number that is larger than (number of Person objects / 3)
    Author:
    Professor Myers

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int add(T p)
      Adds an element to this set.
      boolean contains(java.lang.String key)
      Tests to see if a Person is in the HashTable based on the key
      boolean contains(T p)
      Tests to see if the Person is in the HashTable.
      T getValue(java.lang.String key)
      Returns the Person object that corresponds to the key
      java.util.ArrayList<T> sort()
      Puts the People in the hashtable in a sorted ArrayList, sorted by key (phone number) Use Collections.sort with a Comparator that sorts by phone number

    • Method Detail

      • add

        int add(T p)
        Adds an element to this set. Adds to the appropriate LinkedList by taking the Person HashCode() and mod (%) by the table size.
        Parameters:
        p - a Person to add to the HashTable
        Returns:
        the number of People currently in HashTable

      • contains

        boolean contains(T p)
        Tests to see if the Person is in the HashTable.
        Parameters:
        p - a Person Object
        Returns:
        true if Person is in the HashTable, false if not

      • getValue

        T getValue(java.lang.String key)
        Returns the Person object that corresponds to the key
        Parameters:
        key - the key (phone number) for the Person object
        Returns:
        the Person object if the key is in the hash table, null if not

      • contains

        boolean contains(java.lang.String key)
        Tests to see if a Person is in the HashTable based on the key
        Parameters:
        key - a Person Object key (phone number)
        Returns:
        true if Person is in the HashTable, false if not

      • sort

        java.util.ArrayList<T> sort()
        Puts the People in the hashtable in a sorted ArrayList, sorted by key (phone number) Use Collections.sort with a Comparator that sorts by phone number
        Returns:
        ArrayList of People in hashtable in sorted order by key (phone number)
